pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:5.1: 3. The training rule on swapping robes
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:6.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā was using a robe she had received after swapping with another nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:6.3: The other nun folded up the robe she had received and put it aside.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:6.5: “Venerable, where’s that robe that I swapped with you?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:6.6: She brought out the robe and showed it to her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:6.8: “Here’s your robe, and give me that robe of mine. That which is yours is yours, and that which is mine is mine. Give me that, and take back what’s yours.” And she just took it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:7.1: Then that nun told the nuns what had happened.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:7.2: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:7.3: “How could Venerable Thullanandā swap a robe with another nun and then take it back?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:7.4: Those nuns then told the monks,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:7.5: who in turn told the Master. …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:7.6: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:7.9: How can the nun Thullanandā swap a robe with another nun and then take it back?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:7.10: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:7.11: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:8.1: ‘If a nun swaps robe-cloth with another nun and then says, “Here’s your robe-cloth; give me that robe-cloth of mine. That which is yours is yours, and that which is mine is mine. Give me that, and take back what’s yours;” and she just takes it or gets it taken, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:11.2: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be transferred.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:12.2: much with little, or little with much.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:13.2: if she just takes it herself, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:14.2: if she asks another, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:14.3: If she only asks once, then even if the other takes back many times, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:14.4: The robe-cloth is to be relinquished to the Order of nuns, a group, or an individual nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:14.5: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished in this way.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:14.7: … ‘Venerables, this robe-cloth which I took back after swapping it with another nun is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Order.’ …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:14.10: ‘I give this robe-cloth back to you.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:15.1: If the other person is fully ordained and she perceives her as such, and after having swapped robe-cloth with her she takes it back or gets it taken back, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:15.2: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure if she is, and after having swapped robe-cloth with her she takes it back or gets it taken back, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:15.3: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive her as such, and after having swapped robe-cloth with her she takes it back or gets it taken back, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:16.1: If she swaps another requisite, and then takes it back or gets it taken back, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:16.2: If she swaps robe-cloth or another requisite with someone who is not fully ordained, and then takes it back or gets it taken back, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:16.3: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:16.4: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure if she is, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:16.5: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceives her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:17.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:18.1: The third training rule is finished.
